title: Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS)
text:
Similar pH, electrolytes, and osmolarity to the human body.

Concentration: 1x
pH 7.4




Washing tissues, cells
Common base solvent in many solutions

title: Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS)
text:
Preparation for 1L of 1x PBS

Add 800 mL of \(diH_20\) a sterile container
Add electrolytes

8g \(NaCl\)
0.2g \(KCl\)
1.44g \(Na_2HPO_4\)
0.245g \(KH_2PO_4\)

Adjust pH to 7.4 by titrating appropriate amounts of \(Na_2HPO_4\) or \(KH_2PO_4\)

title: Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS)
text:
Preparation for 1L of 10x PBS

Add 800 mL of \(diH_20\) a sterile container
Add electrolytes

80g \(NaCl\)
2g \(KCl\)
14.4g \(Na_2HPO_4\)
2.45g \(KH_2PO_4\)

Adjust pH to 7.4 by titrating appropriate amounts of \(Na_2HPO_4\) or \(KH_2PO_4\)

title: Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS)
text:
References:

Phosphate-buffered saline (Pbs). Cold Spring Harb Protoc. 2006;2006(1):pdb.rec8247. doi:10.1101/pdb.rec8247

title: Key Resources Tables
text:
Adapted from the Cell Press STAR Methods to help produce Structured, Transparent, Accessible Reporting in research.
This page is a living document and a work-in-progress. With the goal of improving research reproducibility, several major journals now require a detailed listing of the key resources required to conduct the experiments described.
Schedule permitting, I will update the “csv databases”, which can be found on GitHub. Using Quarto and Python, the csv files are rendered into HTML and GitHub-flavored Markdown. The markdown file is additionally rendered in my Wordpress post.
